title: Goldman Sachs raises its first-half 2026 Aluminum Price Forecast and adjusts surplus Outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its London Metal Exchange aluminum price forecast for the first half of 2026 to $3,150 per tonne from $2,575, citing low global inventories, doubts on Indonesian smelter power, and strong demand from EVs and grid expansion. The bank also adjusted its Q4 2026 forecast to $2,500 but expects prices not to stay above $3,000 long-term due to accelerating supply growth. LME aluminum traded at $3,180 per tonne after hitting a nearly three-year high.

title: US ALUMINUM: Trade uncertainty, supply tightness push Midwest Premium above $1/lb
summary: The Platts US Aluminum Midwest Premium hit a record $1.0095/lb on January 23 due to tight spot supply, trade uncertainty over tariffs, and depleted inventories. Market participants expect an influx of imports in early 2026 to rebuild stocks, with premiums remaining elevated through Q1. US aluminum imports fell 25% year-over-year in 2025, while demand remains steady.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,107.50 USD/T on January 30, 2026, down 3.81% from the previous day, after hitting a near 4-year high of 3,296 USD/T on January 28. Over the past month, prices rose 3.72%, and year-over-year they are up 19.74%. The commodity reached an all-time high of 4,103 USD/T in March 2022.

title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Further Drop in February
summary: China's aluminum production in January 2026 rose 2.7% year-over-year and 0.5% month-over-month, but the proportion of liquid aluminum fell 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. Casting ingot volume decreased 5.9% YoY but increased 19.4% MoM. In February, production is expected to decline with fewer days, and liquid aluminum proportion to drop further to 64.4% amid Chinese New Year and high prices.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminum prices surged past USD 5,000 per tonne due to escalating tariffs up to 50%, falling imports, shrinking stocks, and Europe's supply disruptions from CBAM and Russian sanctions. The Midwest premium reached USD 560/mt above tariff costs, creating a 68% premium over LME prices. Domestic production is limited to four smelters, with Century Aluminum restarting capacity.

title: Aluminum Falls from Over 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures fell sharply to $3,100 per tonne from an over three-year high of $3,270 on January 28. The retreat follows recent gains amid broader market trends in base metals.

title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Face a Significant Drop in February: SMM Analysis
summary: China's aluminum production in January 2026 increased 2.7% year-over-year and 0.5% month-over-month, but the proportion of liquid aluminum declined 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. Aluminum casting ingot volume decreased 5.9% YoY but rose 19.4% MoM. Existing capacity stood at 46.209 million mt, with operating capacity at 44.996 million mt; February production is expected to drop significantly amid fewer days and Chinese New Year.

title: US ALUMINUM: Trade uncertainty, supply tightness push Midwest premium above $1/lb
summary: The Platts US Aluminum Midwest Premium hit a record $1.0095/lb on January 23, 2026, due to tight spot supply, import reluctance amid tariff uncertainty, and depleted inventories. Market participants expect elevated premiums through Q1 2026 until new P1020 aluminum imports arrive. US demand remains steady, with average producer orders from January-November 2025 matching 2024 levels.

title: Chalco, Rio Tinto to Buy Brazil's CBA in $886 Million Push for Greener Aluminum
summary: China's Chalco and Rio Tinto will acquire a 68.6% stake in Brazil's Companhia Brasileira de Alumínio (CBA) for $886 million to secure low-carbon aluminum supply amid surging prices. CBA, powered by renewable energy, produced 364,500 tons in 2024, over one-third of Brazil's output. The deal supports greener production as aluminum futures hit record highs near $3,356 per ton.

title: Is aluminium scrap quietly rewriting the global metals playbook especially with EU scrap tension from solar PV India's new policies
summary: The article examines how global aluminium scrap flows, prices, and policies are shifting, with particular focus on India's new regulations adding secondary aluminium to its list of regulated industries under the Greenhouse Gases Emission Intensity Target Rules, 2025. It highlights NALCO's plans to develop 200-300 MW of renewable power capacity paired with battery storage to reduce coal dependence and support sustainable aluminium smelting, while also addressing the challenge of recycling aluminium from solar installations, which now account for 8 million tonnes globally.

title: Aluminum Beverage Can Market Outlook 2026-2034
summary: The market analysis projects the aluminum beverage can market will grow from $41.9 billion in 2025 to $57.4 billion by 2034, driven by sustainability demand and aluminum's 100% recyclability. The report highlights innovations in printed electronics and temperature-sensitive inks creating premium packaging opportunities, with the smart aluminum beverage can market projected to reach $1.2 billion by 2026.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,125 CNY/T on January 30, 2026, down 0.83% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices rose 0.94%, but remain 4.08% lower than a year ago. Steel rebar futures rose toward a 5-month high of CNY 3,150 per tonne amid improved outlook for ferrous metal demand.

title: Steelmaking raw material prices increase through January
summary: All but one steelmaking raw material increased in price over the last month, with coking coal, pig iron, scrap, zinc, and aluminum rising, while iron ore declined 1%. Shredded scrap reached $420 per gross ton and busheling $423/gt, up 8-14% from three months ago. Aluminum Midwest premium hit a record $1.00/lb, up 314% from last year.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 972 USD/T on January 30, 2026, up 3.96% over the past month and 31.35% from a year ago. It recently hit a 36-week high of 941 USD/T on January 28. Forecasts predict 958.30 USD/T by quarter-end and 1034.13 in 12 months.

title: Steel Pulls Back from 5-Month High
summary: Steel rebar futures in China fell to CNY 3,100 per tonne after reaching five-month highs of CNY 3,160 on January 29. The pullback reflects pressure on prices following recent gains.

title: Steel prices today, January 31st: Declining on international markets
summary: Global steel prices declined on January 31 due to increased iron ore inventory pressure at Chinese ports. Domestic markets in Vietnam held steady ahead of Tet holiday.

title: Stainless Steel Market Watch Intensifies as Inventory Rises and Demand Remains Sluggish
summary: Social inventory of stainless steel in China rose to 853,000 mt by January 29, 2026, up 1.05% week-over-week. Demand remains sluggish amid rising inventories.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Vendors report extended lead times of five to six weeks for steel due to strong demand, with seven price increases for steel pipe in 2025. Nucor, the largest U.S. steel producer, kept hot-rolled coil prices stable in late December 2025 after nine weeks of increases. Global updates include China's new steel export licensing framework effective January 1, 2026, and India's three-year tariffs on select steel imports starting at 12%.

title: January 2026 Global Steel & Shipping Industry News Roundup
summary: Mexico has raised tariffs on Chinese goods up to 50%, while Russia increased port fees by 15%, impacting steel trade and global supply chains. These policy changes in early 2026, particularly involving Asia, Mexico, Russia, and Africa, will raise costs for steel transportation. Companies are advised to adjust procurement strategies to mitigate rising expenses.

title: 2026 Circular Steel Summit: Taking stock of tariffs
summary: At the 2026 Fastmarkets Circular Steel Summit in Houston on January 28, industry panelists discussed U.S. tariffs, noting that 18% of steel imports were covered by Section 232 tariffs by end-2024. Tariffs have boosted domestic investment confidence and raw material supply, though 'tariff exhaustion' complicates budgeting. Speakers anticipate supply chain adjustments but see ample domestic product availability.

title: Copper Eases from Surge in Volatile Session
summary: Copper futures in the US surged over 10% to a record high of $6.5 per pound before trimming gains to the $6.2 mark in a volatile trading session. Markets gauged the fundamentals behind the recent speculative rally as copper led the surge in base metals amid bets of higher demand.

title: Copper at Record Highs: What the Rally Means for Markets
summary: Copper prices shattered records in early 2026, reaching a new all-time high of $6.11 USD/lb in January before correcting to $5.97 USD/lb. The rally reflects supply disruptions, tariff concerns, and explosive demand from AI infrastructure and the energy transition, marking a 39.86% year-over-year gain.

title: Why are copper prices rising now: 5 reasons
summary: Copper prices hit an all-time high of $14,125 per metric ton on the London Metal Exchange, representing a 7.9% single-day surge. The rally stems from a perfect storm of speculative intensity, structural supply deficits, AI-driven demand, and geopolitical factors including tariff uncertainty.

title: 3 Top Copper Stocks to Watch as Copper Prices Skyrocket: BHP, FCX, SCCO
summary: Major copper producers rallied as copper prices extended gains, driven by supply disruptions in South America, China's infrastructure stimulus, and accelerating demand from electric vehicle and renewable energy sectors. Copper futures are up 40% since August, with major producers like Southern Copper surging 132% over the past year.

title: Copper Surges Past US$14,000: Best ASX Copper Stocks for 2026
summary: Copper prices hit record highs of US$14,527 amid AI data centre demand and supply shocks. The article highlights top ASX copper stocks positioned to benefit from the sustained rally.

title: IIT-M develops green method to recover metals from e-waste using natural solvents
summary: Researchers at IIT Madras developed a sustainable method to recover valuable metals from electronic waste using environment-friendly solvents derived from natural compounds like thymol and capric acid. Unlike conventional acid-based extraction techniques, this green solvent approach is non-toxic, water-efficient, and generates no hazardous waste, with potential applications for scaling up industrial recycling processes.

title: The Copper Conundrum: Why Meeting AI-Era Electrification Demands is a Race Against Time
summary: S&P Global analysis reveals a critical copper supply challenge, with mined output expected to peak at 25.8 million metric tons in 2030 before declining, creating a potential annual supply gap of 10.1 million metric tons by 2040. The report highlights that energy transition and electric vehicles are driving unprecedented copper demand, requiring unprecedented policy coordination, investment, and technological innovation to address the shortage.

title: Gold Mountains Joins International Copper Association to Advance Sustainable Copper Production
summary: Gold Mountains (H.K.) International Mining Company Limited, a subsidiary of Zijin Mining Group, officially joined the International Copper Association effective January 1, 2026, to strengthen collaboration on sustainable copper production and technological advancement. The membership reflects commitment to advancing the global energy transition and building a more responsible and resilient copper supply chain.

title: Critical battery minerals market outlook for Jan 2026 - policy shifts and supply dynamics
summary: LME 3M nickel price reached a high of US$18,735/tonne, the highest since June 2024, driven by expectations of tightening nickel ore supply in Indonesia. Rumors of enhanced environmental protection efforts resurfacing in the week of January 19, 2026, turned market sentiment bullish. Nickel sulfate prices are projected to average Yuan 29,800-30,400/tonne in January due to cost support from rising nickel prices.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel price fell to 17,555 USD/T on January 30, 2026, down 5.21% from the previous day, easing from a 19-month high of $19,000 touched in late January. The decline follows assessments of lower supply from Indonesia's output cuts, with nickel futures at $18,500 per tonne. Over the past month, prices have risen 4.81%, up 15.27% year-over-year.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices jumped to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026, the highest in over two years, due to Indonesia delaying mining permits and slashing output quotas. This marks a shift from oversupply to supply management, with prices soaring over $4,000 per tonne in four weeks to above US$18,000. Analysts suggest prices could test US$20,000–$22,000/t, potentially up to $25,000 under tightening conditions.

title: Prices for Nickel, Aluminium, and Copper Rise Again
summary: LME nickel prices approached just below USD 18,000 per tonne on January 6, 2026, up more than USD 3,000 since November 2025 amid rising industrial metals prices in Asia. Nickel gained approximately 3.6% at the LME start, with Asian prices up over 4%. Indonesia plans to limit mining in 2026, supporting the upward trend.

title: SunSirs: Shifts Under Indonesia's New Nickel Policy
summary: Indonesia's 2026 nickel ore production quota will drop over 34% to 250-260 million tons from 379 million in 2025, driving LME nickel to a high of $19,160 per ton and Shanghai futures to ¥152,300/ton on January 26. Prices rebounded strongly since mid-December 2025 on quota cut expectations. Forecasts see Shanghai nickel at 120,000-170,000 yuan/ton and LME at 15,000-20,000 USD/ton in 2026.

title: Nickel 28 Files Fiscal Q1 2026 Financial Statements
summary: Nickel 28 reported production of 6,970 tonnes of contained nickel and 648 tonnes of contained cobalt in mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) for fiscal Q1 2026. Sales reached 6,133 tonnes of contained nickel and 569 tonnes of contained cobalt, with average production costs of US$3.61/lb of contained nickel net of by-product sales. The company anticipates achieving its annual production target of 32,000 tonnes of nickel in MHP despite earlier disruptions.

title: Critical battery minerals market outlook for Jan 2026 - policy shifts and supply dynamics
summary: Indonesia plans to adjust its 2026 nickel ore production target to 250–260 million tonnes based on smelter capacity, signaling tighter supply. This aligns with market expectations amid rising nickel prices, with SHFE nickel futures surging significantly in early January 2026. Nickel sulfate prices are projected to average Yuan 29,800-30,400/tonne in January due to cost support from surging intermediates.

title: Shifts Under Indonesia's New Nickel Policy
summary: Indonesia's 2026 nickel ore production quota will drop sharply to 250-260 million tons from 379 million in 2025, exceeding a 34% decline, to tighten supply. Local smelters may require 340-350 million tons, creating a potential gap over 100 million tons and driving nickel prices to highs like LME $19,160/ton on January 26. The policy prioritizes higher-value products like MHP over ferronickel.

title: Indonesia navigates nickel market with output cuts, policy shifts
summary: Indonesia confirmed plans on December 19 to cut nickel production in 2026 via RKAB quotas to support prices and curb harmful operations amid oversupply. Despite quotas, actual production lags approved capacity, but primary nickel supply still exceeds demand. The move could ease global oversupply, with forecasts predicting a market deficit by 2032.

title: Worries grow for Sulawesi farmers as nickel mining company plans expansion
summary: PT Vale Indonesia, operating Indonesia's longest nickel mining concession, seeks expansion amid EV battery demand, potentially affecting local farmlands and forests in Sulawesi. The company's license was extended to 2035, raising concerns over annexation and destruction of community lands rich in biodiversity.

title: 【SMM Nickel Flash News】PT Vale Indonesia Suspends Some Operations
summary: PT Vale Indonesia has suspended some nickel mining operations due to delays in government approval for its annual work plan, as reported by Bloomberg News.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported stable operational performance in its Q4 2025 quarterly activities report, achieving a zero Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR) over 12 months with 17.7 million safe man-hours. The company completed a strategic acquisition of a 10% stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received national recognition for sustainability leadership, including the Indonesia Leadership Award 2025 and CNBC Indonesia's Excellence in Sustainability Leadership Award.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: The Nickel Institute published a new series on sustainability and innovations in nickel production, featuring an interview with Dr. Mark McArthur from NOVONIX about patented all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology designed to reduce costs and environmental impact of nickel-based cathode production. The article also discusses nickel's role in green hydrogen, electric vehicles, and cellulosic ethanol production as part of the energy transition.
